body:
https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/issues/3728

So far I've opted not to touch any LSPs with `root_dir` functions that may or may not include checks for `.git`.  I split the commits up (mostly correctly) into LSPs that had more than 1 root_marker and LSPs that had `.git` as their only root marker, I wasn't sure if we'd end up wanting to keep the `.git` marker on there if its all there is? Also the `nixd` LSP has a root_marker of `git` instead of `.git`, I don't know anything about nixd so didn't touch it, but maybe that was a typo?

Due to the way `vim.lsp.config('*', { ... })` works, using `vim.tbl_deep_extend()` under the hood (which does not merge lists together), adding `.git` to a list of already defined root_markers doesn't currently seem possible, so this is a little blocked. 

From what I can tell the two directions this could go would be:
1. waiting to see how the merge semantics discussions shake out, [a custom 'behavior' function that gets passed to tbl_deep_extend could end up providing the tools to do this?](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/33577#issuecomment-2832866835), and then just documenting how to do that with this change
2. wating for https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/33485, after which this PR could be changed from 'removing .git markers' to putting them in a separate group like: `root_markers = { {'deno.json', 'deno.jsonc'}, {'.git'} }`

@justinmk seems like option 2 was at least the winner to make it into nvim main, should I redo this PR and instead replace all the `.git`s with `{ '.git' }` or would it be premature since root_marker priority wont be actually released for while?

This shouldn't be needed as the default behaviour is directory-up first for each pattern. If `.git` is the last item in `root_markers` it will be evaluated only if other markers aren't found in every directory going up to root.

yeah i was wondering about that. I think #3728 was motivated by the mere *presence* of `.git`.
from https://github.com/neovim/neovim/discussions/33473 : 

>  I'm having trouble with deno/vtsls attaching to the same buffer. 

but after some more thought, this is more like a problem with those insane configs. if they don't want to be enabled under specific conditions, those configs should figure out when they should / should not be enabled. 

after all, `root_markers` is simply a way to *find the top-level directory*. whether a config enables itself is decided by `filetypes`, and/or `root()` in complex cases.

for even more insanity, https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/32287#issuecomment-2835155023 is a likely upcoming approach.

though ideally, "merge" would actually "merge" things instead of the current `tbl_deep_extend` behavior...
